Class MedicationSystem

java.lang.Object
MedicationSystem
public class MedicationSystem extends Object
Represents the medication management system. Handles adding and viewing medications, patients, doctors, and prescriptions. Author: Brandon Maloney Updated by: Abiodun Magret Oyedele Date: 2025-10-19

    • MedicationSystem

      public MedicationSystem()
      Constructor for the MedicationSystem class. Initializes empty lists for medications, patients, doctors, and prescriptions.

  • Method Details

    • addMedication

      public void addMedication(Medication medication)
      Method to add a medication to the system.
      Parameters:
      medication - the Medication object to be added

    • addMedication

      public void addMedication(String id, String name, String dosage, int quantity, LocalDate expiryDate)
      Overload: add medication by details
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the medication
      name - the name of the medication
      dosage - the dosage of the medication
      quantity - the quantity in stock
      expiryDate - the expiry date of the medication

    • addMedication

      public void addMedication(String identifier)
      Overload: add medication by identifier only
      Parameters:
      identifier - the identifier (ID or name) of the medication

    • viewMedications

      public void viewMedications()
      Method to view all medications in the system. Prints the list of medications to the console.

    • removeMedication

      public void removeMedication(String identifier)
      Method to remove a medication from the system by ID or name.
      Parameters:
      identifier - the ID or name of the medication to be removed

    • removeMedication

      public void removeMedication(Medication medication)
      Overload: remove medication by Medication object
      Parameters:
      medication - the Medication object to be removed

    • editMedication

      public void editMedication(String identifier, String newName, String newDosage, Integer newQuantity, LocalDate newExpiryDate)
      Method to edit a medication's details by ID or name.
      Parameters:
      identifier - the ID or name of the medication to be edited
      newName - the new name of the medication (null to keep unchanged)
      newDosage - the new dosage of the medication (null to keep unchanged)
      newQuantity - the new quantity in stock (null to keep unchanged)
      newExpiryDate - the new expiry date (null to keep unchanged)

    • editMedication

      public void editMedication(Medication medication, String newName, String newDosage, Integer newQuantity, LocalDate newExpiryDate)
      Overload: edit medication by Medication object
      Parameters:
      medication - the Medication object to be edited
      newName - the new name of the medication (null to keep unchanged)
      newDosage - the new dosage of the medication (null to keep unchanged)
      newQuantity - the new quantity in stock (null to keep unchanged)
      newExpiryDate - the new expiry date (null to keep unchanged)

      public void searchAll(String keyword)
      Method to search for medications, patients, and doctors by a keyword.
      Parameters:
      keyword - the search keyword Prints matching records to the console.

    • acceptPrescription

      public void acceptPrescription(String patientName, String doctorName, String medicationID, String dosage, int prescribedQuantity)
      Method to accept a prescription.
      Parameters:
      patientName - the name of the patient
      doctorName - the name of the doctor
      medicationID - the ID of the medication
      dosage - the dosage of the medication
      prescribedQuantity - the quantity prescribed Creates a new Prescription object and updates medication stock. Prints confirmation to the console.

    • checkExpiredMedications

      public void checkExpiredMedications()
      Method to check for expired medications in the system. Prints expired medications to the console.

    • restockMedications

      public void restockMedications(int amount)
      Method to restock medications in the system.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to restock each medication Updates medication stock and prints new totals to the console.

    • linkPrescriptionsToPatients

      public void linkPrescriptionsToPatients()
      Method to link prescriptions to their respective patients. Updates each patient's prescription list. Prints the number of linked prescriptions to the console.

    • printPrescriptionsByDoctor

      public void printPrescriptionsByDoctor(String doctorName)
      Method Prints a list of all prescription’s issued by a specific doctor.
      Parameters:
      doctorName - the name of the doctor

    • editPatients

      public void editPatients(String oldName, String name, Integer age, String phoneNumber)
      Edit patients
      Parameters:
      oldName - the current name of the patient to be edited
      name - the new name of the patient (null to keep unchanged)
      age - the new age of the patient (null to keep unchanged)
      phoneNumber - the new phone number of the patient (null to keep unchanged) Updates patient details and prints confirmation to the console.

    • editPatients

      Parameters:
      patient - the Patient object to be edited
      name - the new name of the patient (null to keep unchanged)
      age - the new age of the patient (null to keep unchanged)
      phoneNumber - the new phone number of the patient (null to keep unchanged) Updates patient details and prints confirmation to the console.

      Parameters:

      returns the removed Patient object, or null if not found.

      Edit doctors
      Parameters:
      oldName - the current name of the doctor to be edited
      name - the new name of the doctor (null to keep unchanged)
      age - the new age of the doctor (null to keep unchanged)
      phoneNumber - the new phone number of the doctor (null to keep unchanged)
      specialization - the new specialization of the doctor (null to keep unchanged) Updates doctor details and prints confirmation to the console.
